title: Do you think most musicians are writing and recording new music during the quarantine? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pretty much all the musicians I know are, yes. A lot of them are trying to get into live streaming / online jamming sessions. Of course, the musicians I hang out with are all experimental / electronic musicians. But I would imagine that’s what most musicians with time on their hands and no live gigs are probably doing

No.More than 99% of all musicians only play cover songs. They play covers because it’s easy, and that’s all they ever did.Creating original music requires them to develop their own original creative talent.It’s too hard for them to do because they never did it before. They would rather pretend to be an artist by copying a real artist.But in reality they are just pathetic fakes making a mockery of the art of music.

I would think so yeah. Since you can't really travel, there are no gigs, a perfect time to dust off some of those half baked song ideas or to dream up some new ones and see what you can come up with. Good time to reconnect with friends and family and God, from whom all good things flow.
I would bet MOST real musicians can not HELP writing and recording because it’s in their DNA.
